answers.answer: Low carb, high protein.  I have my test this week and I'm terrified to see the result.  *sigh*
High protein and high fat. Low carb. And whole grain. Try Ezekiel breads. Stay away from white bleached flour. Eggs are great. Red skin potatoes are good too.
Ohh should have mentioned im coeliac too. Yay!

Google "what to eat gestational diabetes" I don't have it but I tried it before I commented and there is some good info on medical websites and some even have diets and guidelines to follow. Hope this helps.
One eggWith a wheat breadOr a corn tortillaI eat a wheat bread with peanut butterI'm not crazy about egg.

My nutritionist put me on a plan of 45g carbs per meal, breakfast lunch and dinner, and three snacks per day at about 15-20g carbs in each snack. High protein to give you energy and all the veggies you want, to fill you up. I eat lots of green salads with lean meat (baked chicken, usually).

I was diagnosed with this last week. I've found that the best breakfast for me is 2 slices of cinnamon raisin toast (30g of carbs), 1 scrambled egg and 3 slices of Turkey bacon. Sometimes I switch out a slice of toast for a cup of milk. I'm only allowed 30g for breakfast... Others are allowed more or less. I'm not a huge fan of eggs either, but you can add a little bit of shredded cheese if needed. If you need any other advice you can PM me. I've done quite a bit of research on what to eat and have discussed meal plans with a dietician. Good luck!
By the way... No fruit in the morning.
Please why no fruits in the morning? @ a wicked3.
I was told that it would raise my blood glucose level too much after fasting because of all the natural sugars. I can eat a serving of fruit as my AM snack but not for breakfast.
Iam to having gestational diabetes.olz some1 do tell in detail what to eat..thanks in advance
Wow gestational diabetes and coeliac disease?  Not that I can offer much in the way of advice, just commiserating with you.

Women with gestational diabetes have to watch the carbs they eat. Foods with heavy carbs include grains (pasta, rice bread), starchy vegetables (potatoes, corn), fruits, dairy, and fats. I'm limited to 30g of carbs for breakfast and 45g of carbs for lunch and dinner. I can have a 15g snack between breakfast-lunch and lunch-dinner and a 30g snack after dinner. Proteins like cheese/meats/meat substitutes have negligible carbs.Breakfast: 2 slices of buttered cinnamon raisin bread (30g of carbs), 3 slices of Turkey bacon and 1 scrambled egg.Lunch: a Turkey sandwich with cheese (heated up) (30g for the 2 slices of bread) and a side of 1 serving of fruit (15g)Dinner: 1/2 cup potato or pasta or 1/3 cup rice (15g), some type of meat (protein), a non-starchy vegetable, a serving of fruit (15g) and a dinner roll (15g)Snacks: Greek yogurt (15-17g), a protein bar (17g), a serving of fruit (15g), string cheese, cottage cheese, 1 oz. cheese and 6 saltine crackers (15g), 1 serving of nuts...My advice is to know which foods have the most carbs and make sure to check the nutrition label to make sure how much you can eat.
Low carb, high protein, low sugar.

question: I just got told i have gestational diabetes. I dont have an appt yet and i dont know what to eat. Can someone who is dealing with this please tell me what they eat for breakfast. Its 9am here and im too scared to eat.
